intro: Euchloris, commonly known as the golden bellflower, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, yellowish-orange flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, while its stems are upright and branching. Euchloris is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and rockeries.
